description: The Purple Giant Hyssop (Agastache rugosa 'Golden Jubilee’) is a stunning and unique member of the mint family, producing fragrant blue and purple spikes in the summertime. This drought-resistant perennial grows 1-3 feet tall and produces lovely yellow blooms which attract butterflies and hummingbirds. It spreads quickly, with an array of trusses combining to create an eye-catching border. Foliage is aromatic and deeply cut, releasing a heady scent with a hint of aniseed when crushed. With regular trimming and deadheading, it is long-flowering and requires minimal upkeep. Plus, it’s great for pollinator gardens!
